title: Are giant panda bears the least dangerous bear, and the only bear we can play with? - Quora

response.answer_text: First off, yes, it’s true that the panda isn’t really a bear. That said… yes it is. Taxonomy be damned, nobody is going to convince me that pandas aren’t bears. They’re so obviously fricking bears. Now then, that aside: no, I would not play with a panda bear. They are less dangerous than a lot of other animals their size, due to their tendency to not move a whole lot, but don’t think that means you can just walk up to one and hug it. They still have claws, they still have teeth, and regardless of what zoologists say, it’s still a bear, and if you piss one off, it can and will do things to you. So in short: yes, they are probably the least dangerous bear, but no, I would not play with one. I would also proffer the advice that you probably shouldn’t try to play with any wild animal, no matter how cute and cuddly they look. None of them want to play with humans, and all of them have ways of saying so that hurt. Play with cats and dogs all you want, but for the love of god, don’t go trying to pet a bear… EDIT: So it seems I stand corrected. Apparently, pandas actually are considered to be bears, by taxonomy as well as by common sense. So… I was mistaken in that regard. That said, this new information does nothing to negate my point; if anything, it helps it. Pandas are bears, and bears will kill you in the face, ergo… don’t try to play with pandas.

Well actually, the least dangerous bear is the American Black Bear. These bears are the most likely to run away from humans, but that doesn’t mean they can potentially attack or even kill humans. Pandas are actually quite high on the aggression list when it comes to bears. The most aggressive bear is surprisingly the smallest bear: the Sun Bear. Here’s a list from most aggressive bear (top) to least aggressive bear (bottom): —Sun Bear —Polar Bear —Giant Panda —Sloth Bear —Asiatic Black Bear —Grizzly Bear —Eurasian Brown Bear —Spectacled Bear —American Black Bear Some may disagree with this list, but this order is what I believe.

While I’m not exactly sure what bears is the least dangerous.. I am sure that every bear species is a bear. You do not mess with bears because they will kill you. Even though pandas look cuddly and sleepy right now, I assure you they are incredibly territorial and do have the claws, teeth and strength to kill you. Pandas being territorial is one of the main reasons they have low birthrates. They like to be left alone and will attack even other pandas if the timing isn’t right. Pandas are not vegetarians due to the fact that they also kill and eat small animals, so don’t make the news as the one person eaten by a panda.

We can not play with Pandas. Pandas are bears and not to be messed with. There was a keeper where I used to work who only had one hand, a panda bit the other right off. People are also occasionally attacked by wild pandas and by pandas in zoos. They look cute, but……  P.S. Pandas really are bears. Order: Carnivora, Family: Ursidae. Raccoons are the family Procyonidae. DNA tests have revealed that the Giant Panda’s closest relative is the South American spectacled bear.

First, it's the giant panda. Not the giant panda bear. Giant panda is the one of the most lovable animals in the world. They do not hurt people or other animals except one situation. When someone want to hurt their baby the mother will be very dangerous like other ferocious bears. However, most of the time in their life is bubbling the bamboo calmly. Their IQ is comparable to a child of five to seven years old. People can play with them but most people can't have a chance to play with them. After all, the giant panda is the national treasure in China. Here's a website about giant pandas in China www.ipanda.com

Nope the least dangerous bear is a water bear. They are 1.5 mm long and are in no way related to other bears.  Pandas are giant, lazy, and not at all playful. They will attack you if provoked, leave them alone! They are wild animals and deserve to be left alone in the wild. If you see one you can look at it but please let it be.

A panda may be less dangerous then other bears but I strongly suggest against playing with them. They still have sharp claws, pointy teeth and are wild unpredictable animals. This is not the most vicious attack but its bad enough.  They might seem cute and cuddly but I would not recommend giving them a hug.

Giant Pandas are dangerous there was a man that was attacked by a wild panda. the poor man had to get his leg removed because it was badly chewed up. The officials are trying to capture the panda. In China in a zoo there was a drunk guy that decided to jump into the panda enclosure to cuddle a panda named Gu gu. Gu gu got pissed and mawed the drunk guy. What I've heard is gu gu has a reputation for mawing people he's had other people jump in to his enclosure where he mawed them. So pandas are mean and aggressive.

Giant pandas are very cute, they love to eat bamboo to sleep and climb trees. Giant pandas are very timid, so they often climb into trees when in danger. The giant panda and the breeder in the zoo are very harmonious. But pandas in the wild are still offensive and dangerous.  So when we meet giant panda in the wild, we will stay away from it. Here are the changes of giant pandas from dangerous beasts to cute animals How do pandas survive in the wild?

Pandas are arguably the cutest creatures on this planet, full of love and always up for cuddles. I know many Chinese guys who ask giant pandas for cuddles when they do not feel sleepy or need some motivation. Pandas are as good as toys with movement and feelings. Befriending a panda is easier than befriending humans. They even shake hands to greet people. Yeah, the only time I remember a panda not being in terms with a human was when the human asked if panda could give him a ride to which big cute bear refused, it was due to sheer laziness.

It’s still a bear and you DON’T want to be close to one that is not used to humans, unless you have a death wish. Remember the fact that bear trainers are always very careful and still tend to have enough scars to pass for a menzur swordfighter.

Koala bears are probably safer than Pandas. They’re smaller and people often hold them.Though they will poop on you, and many have chlamydia. So there’s no such thing as ‘safe bear,’ just ‘safer bear.’ Koala chlamydia: The STD threatening an Australian icon - BBC News
No. You shouldn’t play with wild animals. Even a Cub’s razor sharp claws can cut open an artery but also Bears shouldn’t be taught to be too familiar with Humans, not even Pandas.
I think Pooh is the only bear who is safe to play with.

For a start Pandas aren't bears they are their own species. Giant Pandas will generally walk away from disturbance and trouble. I really don't know what one would do should you corner it and it felt threatened but I imagine they are quite strong so I'd avoid it!
